intro: Gnidia anthylloides, commonly known as the yellow stinkwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, woody fruits. It is often found in coastal forests and sandy soils, and it has a strong, unpleasant odor, which is why it is sometimes referred to as the "stinkwood."
